intro: Halenia asclepiadea, commonly known as the blue bell or white bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species, and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with five petals that curve inward, giving it a distinctive appearance. Halenia asclepiadea is often found in dry habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
